isis.stitle: Body Builder Electrical Data Book - SINGLE REDUCTION AXLES: SPICER S100-S, S105-S, S135-S, S150-S - ASSEMBLE - DIFFERENTIAL

step1.para: If ring gear was removed from differential case, re-install at this time. Bolt ring gear to differential case in three places, 120 degrees apart, before compressing rivet; this will eliminate ring gear runout. Use hydraulic or mechanical press and suitable riveting fixture ( Figure 27). Pressure requirement per rivet is 45 to 50 U.S. tons (41 to 45 metric tons).

figure.caption: Figure 27. Use Hydraulic or Mechanical Press and Suitable Riveting Fixture

step1.para: Press bearing cones onto differential case halves. Place bearing cups on cones during remainder of assembly to prevent damage to bearings.
Apply a small amount of gear lubricant to all mating surfaces. This will aid in assembly by keeping parts together and providing initial lubrication.
Place thrust washer and side gear in differential case flange half.
Assemble pinion mates and thrust washers onto cross shaft. Place assembly in flange half differential case.
Place remaining side gear and thrust washer in position on differential pinions.
Assemble case halves, making sure match marks are lined up.
Install differential case bolts. Tighten evenly to 100 to 120 ft-lbs. (135 to 163 Nm).
